entry.title: US Dollar Shortages: Ethiopia and Nigeria in $100 Million Currency Swap Transaction
entry.summary:
According to a report, the central banks of Ethiopia and Nigeria recently consummated a $100 million currency swap transaction. Under the arrangement, an Ethiopian airliner was paid local currency equivalent to $100 million while Dangote Cement is said to have received a similar amount of nairas.
Ongoing U.S. Dollar Shortages
The central bank of Ethiopia is reported to have performed a $100 million currency swap transaction with its Nigerian counterpart. Under the swap agreement, Ethiopia‚Äôs national airliner, which has been unable to repatriate funds trapped in Nigeria, took over the Nigeria cement company Dangote Cement‚Äôs profits which were similarly stuck in Ethiopia.
According to a local report, the two central banks resorted to the swap transaction because the arrangement obviat‚Ä¶

Australia‚Äôs NAB Bank Won‚Äôt Process Payments To ‚ÄúRisky‚Äù Exchanges
entry.summary:
National Australia Bank (NAB) has implemented measures to block certain payments to crypto exchanges deemed ‚Äúhigh-risk,‚Äù following similar actions taken by other major Australian banks, including Commonwealth Bank of Australia and Westpac, according to reports¬†on July 17.
Protecting Clients
The NAB warned that crypto scams are putting Australians at risk, causing losses of $151 million in 2022. Subsequently, it has taken steps to protect its client base and won‚Äôt process fiat payments to certain exchanges it deemed ‚Äúhigh risk.‚ÄùAccording to recent Australian Financial Crimes Exchange data, nearly half of all reported scam funds in the past month were crypto-related.
Although the bank took a cautionary measure, it didn‚Äôt clarify which cryptocurrency exchange had been impacted. At the ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ripple Crypto Euphoria: Decision On ‚ÄòShaky Ground,‚Äô Ex-SEC Director Says
entry.summary:
The Ripple ruling has positioned John Reed Stark, the former director of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission Office of Internet Enforcement, as a prominent cautionary figure in the cryptocurrency industry.
Though the SEC has generally been considered to have suffered by the judgment, Stark has expressed reservations about its stability and the likelihood of appeals and reversals.
He advised the community to exercise caution and refrain from premature jubilation in an article that provoked thinking on July 14.
Stark‚Äôs viewpoint is fundamental because of his knowledge and experience in securities law. Despite its initial euphoria, he argues that the Ripple decision should not be immediately praised as a massive triumph for the cryptocurrency industry.
Ripple Jubilation Tempor‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ripple Eyes US Banks after Legal Victory against the Regulator
entry.summary: Ripple has expressed optimism that banks and financial institutions in the US will start using its cryptocurrency, XRP following the court ruling in the case between the blockchain company and the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Last week, a judge in New York ruled that Ripple did not violate federal securities laws by selling XRP on public exchanges. However, the ruling, which concluded a long-standing legal battle between Ripple and the SEC, stated that the blockchain firm contravened the law by selling XRP to institutional clients. Additionally, the sale of XRP by Ripple‚Äôs CEO, Brad Garlinghouse, and the Co-Founder and former CEO, Chris Larsen, on cryptocurrency exchanges did not amount to offering unregistered securities. Similarly, the federal court added‚Ä¶

entry.title: Crypto Needs Uniformity and Rigor after 2022's Crisis, FSB Reveals
entry.summary: The Financial Stability Board (FSB) has issued a global regulatory framework for crypto-asset activities. This move is aimed at bolstering the comprehensiveness and international uniformity of crypto regulatory and supervisory approaches. The move comes at a time when more is being said and done around the world in terms of defining a legal framework for the digital asset market. FSB Aims for Global Consistency in Crypto Regulation This framework acknowledges the inherent volatility and structural vulnerabilities of crypto-assets and their ecosystem players. Events over the past year underscored the potential for a key service provider's failure to transmit risks across the crypto-asset ecosystem rapidly. It brings a risk of potential spillover into the broader financia‚Ä¶

entry.title: QED: A Zk-Native Blockchain Capable of Serving Millions of Concurrent Users
entry.summary:
PRESS RELEASE. July 17th, 2023, Hong Kong. Startup Open Asset Standards has recently announced QED, the world‚Äôs first ZK 2.0 blockchain protocol. Unlike existing zero knowledge blockchain protocols, QED has a novel state model which is horizontally scalable, meaning it is no longer limited by TPS restrictions that have previously prevented adoption of blockchain technologies in Web2 use cases such as social networks, traditional finance, and gaming.
Enabled by advances in fast recursive zero knowledge proofs, QED is able to achieve this scale without compromising security or decentralization and proves all transactions end-to-end using proof recursion (verifying a zero knowledge proof in a zero knowledge proof ). This process of decentralized recursive proving culminates in a single bloc‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Lightning Network Strikes Binance: Integration Completed
entry.summary:
In a groundbreaking announcement, Binance, the world‚Äôs largest crypto exchange, has successfully completed the integration of the Bitcoin Lightning Network. In a blog post published on Monday, July 17, the exchange announced that deposits and withdrawals for Bitcoin (BTC) are now open on the Lightning Network.
This integration marks a significant milestone for the industry as it opens up new avenues for faster, more efficient, and scalable Bitcoin transactions. Back in May 2023, Binance hinted at an imminent integration. The exchange temporarily halted Bitcoin withdrawals due to an unprecedented surge in volume triggered by increased interest in Ordinals. After successfully resolving the issue, Binance said it was ‚Äúworking hard‚Äù to enable BTC Lightning Network withdrawals.
Bitcoin Ligh‚Ä¶

entry.title: SEC Accepts Blackrock‚Äôs Bitcoin ETF Application
entry.summary:
The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has accepted the application for a bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF) filed by asset manager Blackrock. The move indicates the regulator is preparing to seriously consider a bitcoin ETF and could eventually set the stage for wider adoption of crypto assets and products.
SEC Adds Blackrock‚Äôs Bitcoin ETF Application to Docket, Seeks Public Comments
The U.S. securities regulator has officially accepted Blackrock‚Äôs application for a spot bitcoin ETF. Once it‚Äôs published in the Federal Register, the SEC will open a 21-day window for submission of public comments on the proposal and they will be posted on its website.
The application‚Äôs addition to the SEC‚Äôs docket on Thursday marks the beginning of a long review process that will be closely‚Ä¶

entry.summary: Worldcoin, a startup that aims to build the ‚Äúworld‚Äôs largest identity and financial network as a public utility,‚Äù has reached two million sign-ups. The company, which uses its biometric World ID system to differentiate human beings, stated it has more than doubled the number of sign-ups since January when it reported having passed its first million. Worldcoin Passes 2 Million Sign-Ups The Worldcoin project, a startup building an identity database of users as a public utility, has reached two million sign-ups using its World ID protocol. The company ‚Äî which is backed by Openai co-founder Sam Altman ‚Äî reported that these sign-ups came via people registering from cities such as Barcelona, Berlin, Buenos Aires, New York, Seoul, and Tokyo, as part of the ‚Äúworld tour‚Äù announced in May. entry.title: Former SEC Official Warns of Reversal in SEC v Ripple Ruling on XRP ‚Äî Says ‚Äòthe Decision Resides on Shaky Ground‚Äô
entry.summary:
The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission‚Äôs former head of internet enforcement has warned that the ruling on the SEC v. Ripple case ‚Äúresides on shaky ground‚Äù and will likely be reversed. ‚ÄúThe Ripple decision grants to the institutional investor full SEC protection ‚Ä¶ However, the retail investor is not granted any SEC protection at all. This seems backwards to say the least,‚Äù he stressed.
SEC v Ripple Ruling ‚ÄòTroubling on Multiple Fronts‚Äô
Former U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) official John Reed Stark shared his analysis of the SEC v. Ripple ruling concerning XRP on Linkedin Friday. entry.title: Crypto Sponsorships: Innovations in Payment and Tokenization
entry.summary: Cryptocurrencies have made huge inroads into the sponsorship industry, altering payment systems and introducing tokenization to the sports, entertainment, and gaming industries. As cryptocurrencies acquire widespread adoption, an increasing number of businesses are investigating the benefits of crypto sponsorships, harnessing the unique properties of digital assets to improve transactions and communicate with their target audiences. In this article, we will look at the payment and tokenization advancements brought about by crypto sponsorships, as well as their prospective influence on numerous businesses. entry.title: India and UAE Break Away From US Dollar: Landmark Agreement Enables Trade Settlements in Rupees and Dirhams
entry.summary:
In a compelling turn of events this Saturday, India and the United Arab Emirates (UAE) inked a landmark agreement facilitating trade transactions to be settled in their native currencies, rupees and dirhams, instead of relying on the U.S. dollar. India‚Äôs prime minister Narendra Modi visited the UAE, where the countries announced the linking of the UAE‚Äôs Instant Payments Platform (IPP) and India‚Äôs Unified Payments Interface (UPI).
India, UAE Ink Deal for Trade in Native Currencies
India and the UAE signed a memorandum of understanding Saturday to promote trade settlements in rupees and dirhams. entry.title: 'Play-to-Earn Is Not Dead. It Will Never Die' Says Words with Friends Creator Paul Bettner
entry.summary: Words With Friends and Wildcard Creator Paul Bettner tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his perspective on Axie Infinity and Web3 games.

entry.title: Cross the Ages Game Review: A Tough But Rewarding Card Battler
entry.summary: Cross the Ages is a digital collectible card game that challenges players to duel online opponents‚Äîand you can even mint your cards as tradable NFTs. It's complex and difficult to grasp at first, but this mobile-first game has some serious strategic upside. GG contributor Ryan Gladwin puts Cross the Ages through its paces.
